NRL: Roosters v Raiders at Allianz Stadium. Kick-off at 6:15pm, full time around 8:15pm.

Motorists should allow extra travel time on roads approaching and around Moore Park including the Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde and Lang Rd.

Driver Ave will be partially closed outside the stadium from 3:15pm and will reopen once crowds have safely cleared the area after the game.

No through-traffic will be available on Driver Ave. Access to EP3 grass car park and drop off areas maintained from Lang Rd. EP2 will not be open for this match.

Special event clearways will be in effect on roads in Moore Park and surrounding areas from 1pm until 9pm including sections of Lang Rd, Fitzroy St, Moore Park Rd, Albion St, Cleveland St, Flinders St and Foveaux St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. properties.otherAdvice:
State of Origin Game III at Accor Stadium at Olympic Park. Kick off 8:05pm. Finish approx 10pm.

Traffic will be heavy on roads approaching the precinct as thousands of fans travel to the stadium during the busy evening peak.

Allow plenty of extra travel time on roads approaching Olympic Park including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

Fans are encouraged to arrive early and pre-book parking online ahead of time, available until 11:59pm the night before the event unless sold out prior.

Some local roads within Sydney Olympic Park will close as early as 5pm on Tuesday 11 July and some will stay closed until 3am on Thursday 13 July. See the Sydney Olympic Park road closure map for details. Allow extra time and follow the directions of traffic controllers on site.

If you're driving from the north, use Silverwater Rd, Holker St and Hill Rd to access to precinct car parks and avoid heavy traffic expected on Homebush Bay Drive and Underwood Rd.

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road, Centenary Drive

properties.otherAdvice:
FIBA Women's Basketball Asia Cup at Quaycentre, Sydney Olympic Park Sports Centre from Monday 26 June to Sunday 2 July.

Allow extra travel time on roads approaching the precinct including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd. Traffic will be heavier than usual as fans travel to and from the games, particularly in busy evening peak times.

The precinct will be busier than usual on Sunday 2 July as an NRL match also takes place at Accor Stadium from 2pm.

Sydney Olympic Park Authority may close some local roads to accommodate increased public transport services and ensure pedestrian safety during events. Visit Sydney Olympic Park Authority and check out the interactive map.

Attendees are encouraged to pre-book parking online ahead of time to secure a space, available until 11:59pm the night before the event.

AFL: Sydney Swans v Geelong Cats at SCG. AFL first bounce at 7:50pm, full time approx. 10:30pm

Traffic will be heavier than usual as thousands of fans travel to the stadium. Motorists should allow extra travel time on roads approaching and around Moore Park including the Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde and Lang Rd.

Driver Ave will be partially closed outside the stadium from 2pm and will reopen once crowds have safely cleared the area after the game.

No through-traffic will be available on Driver Ave, however access to EP2 Kippax car park will be maintained via Moore Park Rd and access to EP3 grass car park maintained from Lang Rd - car parks open from 4:45pm.

Special event clearways will be in effect on roads in Moore Park and surrounding areas from 3pm until midnight including sections of Lang Rd, Fitzroy St, Moore Park Rd, Albion St, Cleveland St, Flinders St and Foveaux St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

properties.otherAdvice:
Up to 8,000 people will take part in the annual Sydney Harbour 10k and 5k on Sunday 23 July.

Events start from George St in The Rocks from 7:30am. The course travels around the harbour foreshore using on and off-road pathways via Dawes Point, Millers Point, Barangaroo, King St Wharf , Darling Harbour and Pyrmont. To safely facilitate the fun run, road closures will be in place.

ROAD CLOSURES:

  • 4am to 1pm: Circular Quay West at the OPT
  • 4:30am to 11am: George St from Alfred St to Hickson Rd and Hickson Rd from George St to Park Hyatt
  • 6am to 10am: Hickson Rd between Napoleon St and Barton St and northbound lanes Sussex St from King St to Erskine St and Slip St
  • 6am to 11am: Hickson Rd from Park Hyatt to Barton St and Napoleon St between Kent St and Hickson St. Hickson Rd from George St in The Rocks through to Erskine St at King Street Wharf as well as sections of Dalgety Rd, Napoleon St, Towns Pl, Waterman’s Quay and Barangaroo Ave
  • 7:30am to 10am: Sections Murray St & Pirrama Rd, Wharf Cres, Darling Island Rd and Wharf 7/10 Service Rd in Pyrmont.
  • 8:30am to 9:30am: Cuthbert St, King St, Lime St, Erskine St and Shelley St at King St Wharf

Changed local access arrangements will be in place around King Street Wharf/Barangaroo between 8:30am and 9:15am and in Pyrmont between 7:30am and 10am.

Eastbound traffic: Bathurst Road, Valley Road, Narrow Neck Road, Farnells Road, Catalina Avenue, Peckmans Road and Gates Avenue to reach the Katoomba town centre.

Westbound traffic: Kulgoa Street and Bathurst Road to reach the Katoomba town centre.

Access to Scenic World and Echo Point (Three Sisters) is via Leura Mall.

webLinks.linkText: FIFA Women’s World Cup 2023™️ Sydney Harbour Bridge Unity Celebration

properties.publicTransport: Buses will start and end trips either side of the Harbour Bridge in North Sydney and in the city while it's closed to traffic. Trains will continue to operate across the bridge. The cycleway and walkway will also remain open. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
A ticketed FIFA Women’s World Cup 2023™️ Sydney Harbour Bridge Unity Celebration event will be held on the Bridge deck on Sunday morning from 7.30am.

The Harbour Bridge and Cahill Expressway will be closed in both directions from 4am to 10.30am. The Harbour Bridge walkway and cycleway will remain open.

Motorists will be diverted via the Sydney Harbour Tunnel however delays are expected, drivers are urged to avoid the area until after 10.30am where possible.

Key road closures

  • From 4am to 10:30am: all lanes of the Sydney Harbour Bridge will be closed in both directions including the Cahill Expressway Circular Overpass. A section of Burton St at Milsons Point will remain closed until 11.30am.
  • Motorists will be diverted via the Sydney Harbour Tunnel in both directions. Drivers can also consider using Victoria Rd and Gladesville Bridge as an alternative route.
  • Citybound traffic from the Anzac Bridge will be detoured via Bathurst St off-ramp and all traffic accessing the Western Distributor from Fig St and Pyrmont St will be detoured via the King St off-ramp.

Special event clearway parking restrictions will be in effect in North Sydney and the Sydney CBD to accommodate traffic on detour routes while the bridge is closed.

  • In North Sydney and Milsons Point from 3am to 10.30am: on Pacific Hwy between Berry and Walker Streets, a section of Alfred St South and Burton St.
  • In Sydney CBD from 6am to 10.30am: on sections of Sussex, King, Elizabeth, Park, Bathurst, Clarence, York, William and Riley Streets.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and businesses with parking permits or TfNSW Mobility Scheme permit holders. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

arrangementElements.html:
MILSONS POINT

From 4:00am to 11:30pm

  • Burton Street between Alfred Street South and Broughton Street  

CAHILL EXPRESSWAY - ALL RAMPS AND APPROACHES

FROM 4:00AM TO 10:30AM

  • Cahill Exp overpass between Bradfield Highway, Conservatorium Road & Domain Tunnel

SYDNEY HARBOUR BRIDGE - ALL RAMPS AND APPROACHES

FROM 4:00AM TO 10:30AM

  • Bradfield Highway (Sydney Harbour Bridge) Lanes 1, 2, 3, 4, 5 and 6
  • Cahill Expressway (Sydney Harbour Bridge) Lanes 7 and 8
  • Pacific Highway between Bradfield Highway and High Street
  • Pacific Highway between Lavender Street and Blue Street
  • Warringah Freeway all access ramps and lanes to/from Sydney Harbour Bridge

WESTERN DISTRIBUTOR

FROM 4:00AM TO 10:30AM

Connecting ramps between the Western Distributor and Sydney Harbour Bridge will be closed. Access will be maintained to Sydney CBD via ANZAC Bridge and the Pyrmont Street and Fig Street on ramps, exiting to the Bathurst Street and King Street off ramps.

Western Distributor

  • ANZAC Bridge on ramp1 from Darling Harbour overpass
  • Cross City Tunnel exit2 to Harbour Street / CBD North Northbound
  • Western Distributor3 between Bathurst Street and Bradfield Highway Northbound
  • Sydney Harbour Bridge southern on-ramp between Grosvenor Street and Bradfield Hwy Northbound
  • Harbour Street between Bathurst Street and Western Distributor on-ramp to SHB
  • Western Distributor between Bradfield Highway and Blackwattle Place Southbound

Notes:

1 Traffic will be detoured to the King Street off ramp into Sydney CBD.

2 The Cross City Tunnel exit southbound to Bathurst Street will remain open.

3 Managed access available to Wheat Road for King Street Wharf and Barangaroo South precincts.

 

King Street wharf access

Motorists will be able to access King Street Wharf precinct via Erskine Street and Wheat Road. Erskine Street is the recommended approach as the Wheat Road approaches are expected to become heavier as the morning progresses.

Wheat Road approaches:

·       from the Western Distributor - Bathurst Street exit: left via the slip lane onto the Western Distributor then left into Wheat Road. No access to Sydney Harbour Bridge.

·       from Harbour Street northbound at Bathurst Street: managed access straight ahead then left into Wheat Road. No access to Sydney Harbour Bridge

roads.mainStreet: Moore Park Road, Anzac Parade, Lang Road, Eastern Distributor

properties.otherAdvice:
Super Netball Semi Final: Swifts v Thunderbirds at Qudos Bank Arena. Main game from 7pm, full time around 8:35pm.

Allow extra travel time on roads approaching the precinct including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

Traffic may be heavier than usual as fans travel to the venue for the match.

Fans are encouraged to arrive early and pre-book parking online ahead of time, available until 11:59pm the night before the event.

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road
